description.en:
The course provides an overview of Estonian literary history in the context of the Estonian cultural history with a focus on the central authors of the literary canon and outlines main tendencies and phenomena in contemporary Estonian literature. It also focuses on literary institutions and organisations and publication and information channels. The work of two canonic authors from different periods and two prominent developments of contemporary Estonian literature will be studied more thoroughly. The course takes place in combined format of seminar and lectures. Lectures provide wider cultural contexts and introduction to literary periods and phenomena. Seminars will focus on the discussion and analysis of a selection of literary works and on films based on literary works. Lectures and seminars are partially held together with the course HVKU.05.004.
In case it is possible, the course will include literary excursions and tours (e.g., the Estonian Literary Museum, Tartu as Unesco Literary City).
description.et: Kursus annab ülevaate eesti kirjandusloost üldises kultuuriloolises kontekstis, samuti käsitletakse eesti nüüdiskirjanduse põhijooni, suundi ja autoreid, samuti kirjandusega seotud asutusi, organisatsioone, väljaandeid ja infokanaleid. Põhjalikumalt käsitletakse kahte kanoonilist kirjanikku ja nende põhiteoseid erinevatest perioodidest ning kaht nüüdiskirjanduse olulist suunda. Kursus toimub osaliselt koos kursusega HVKU.05.004. Kursus toimub loengute ja seminaride segaformaadina. Loengutes antakse laiem kirjandus- ja kultuurilooline taust, seminarid keskenduvad kirjandusteoste ja nende põhjal tehtud filmide arutelule. Võimalusel hõlmab kursus ka ekskursioone Tartu kirjanduslikesse paikadesse (nt Eesti Kirjandusmuuseum, kirjanduslik Tartu, Tartu kui UNESCO kirjanduslinn).

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give foreign students an overview of Estonian literary history and contemporary Estonian literature in the context of the Estonian cultural history with in-depth insights into the work of a selection of canonic authors and noteworthy literary developments.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on eesti kirjandusloo, selle olulisemate protsesside ja autorite ning nüüdiskirjanduse peamiste suundade tutvustamine välisüliõpilastele üldise Eesti kultuuriloo kontekstis koos põhjalikemate sisevaadetega valiku kesksete autorite loomingusse ja olulistesse arengusuundadesse.

learning_outcomes.en:
acquire an overview of the Estonian literary and cultural history and are able to connect it to the literature and culture of their country or region. They have general knowledge about the central authors and works in the Estonian literary canon and the main themes, directions and authors of contemporary Estonian literature and more in-depth knowledge of a selection of works of Estonian authors. They know how to find information about Estonian literature in magazines, reference works and online resources.
Estonian students gain an experience of introducing Estonian literature in English to audiences with little previous knowledge of Estonian literature and culture, including the format of presentations and moderating discussions in English.
learning_outcomes.et:
Kursuse läbinud välisüliõpilane:
- Omab ülevaadet eesti kirjanduse arengust ja oskab seda suhestada Eesti üldise kultuurilooga ja võrdlevalt oma maa/regiooni kirjanduskultuuriga
- On kursis eesti nüüdiskirjanduse peamiste teemade, suundade ning autoritega
- Omab ülevaadet eesti kirjanduskaanoni kesksetest autoritest ja nende loomingust
- On süvendatult tutvunud valiku eesti kirjanike loominguga
- Oskab otsida täiendavat infot eesti kirjanduse kohta (ajakirjad, andmebaasid) ning omab ülevaadet kirjandusega seotud asutustest ja organisatsioonidest Eestis

independent_work.et:
Preparation for the seminars (reading the assigned texts). 
Reading journal. One entry of about 300 words for every seminar topic that reflects on themes, formal and generic features of the works covered and one longer entry (about 500-700 words) where you reflect on one or several discussion points in more in-depth manner.  Deadline: one week after the class where the topics were discussed.  

Literary history group assignment. Foreign students and Estonian students work together, group size depends on number of participants in the course. Each group prepares an overview of one period of Estonian literature and presents it in class also submitting a powerpoint, Prezi presentation or presentation text that will be uploaded to the course Moodle site.  Presentation should be about 15 minutes, use of illustrative material (photos, videos, extracts of literary texts is encouraged). Presentation topic also include authors whose work is discussed in seminars (group size 7 students). The assignment can be done in combination with students from HVKU.05.004 (3CP, BA level). In the group, students of this course should focus on more advanced themes and perspectives (e.g, wider cultural background of the period, discussion of the characteristic features of a featured author, etc.).

Presentation topics:
Literary processes and central authors from late 19th century until 1940. Fiction.
Literary processes and central authors from late 19th century until 1940. Poetry.
Estonian literature during the Soviet era. Several foci can be picked and more than one presentation on this topic can be prepared.
Estonian literature from the late 1980s until the turn of the century. Several foci can be picked and more than one presentation on this topic can be prepared.
Contemporary Estonian literature. Here as well, several foci and be selected.

description.et: General introduction: time schedule, topics, materials and tasks. In seminar: a glimpse of Estonian literature.
Estonian folk heritage. Excursion to the Estonian Folklore Archive of the Estonian Literary Museum (Vanemuise 42).
Early Estonian Literature. Poetry of Lydia Koidula and Kristjan Jaak Peterson. Life story of Mäletu Jaan.
Reading week. Watching the film Tõde ja õigus (Truth and Justice) or Reading part I of the novel.
A. H. Tammsaare. Truth and justice/Tõde ja õigus (1926-1933). Discussion of the film and the novel.
Poetry of Juhan Liiv, Gustav Suits, Marie Under and Betti Alver.
Juhan Smuul. "Antractica Ahoi!" Jaan Kross "The Ashtray."
Imbi Paju's documentary "Memories Denied" (Tõrjutud mälestused, 2005) or Martti Helde's film "In the Crosswind" (Risttuules, 2014). A selection of Estonian life stories concerning Soviet repressions.
Reading week. Please read one novel (The Border State, The Seventh Spring of Peace, The Willow King or The Man Who Spoke Snakish) in full.
Contemporary Estonian fiction. Tõnu Õnnepalu. "The Border State" (Piiririik) or, shorter selections by several authors. Viivi Luik "The Seventh Spring of Peace" (1984, selections).
Contemporary Estonian Fiction. Meelis Friedenthal. "The Willow King" or Andrus Kivirähk "The Man Who Spoke Snakish" (selections).
Excursion to Juhan Liivi Museum in Kodavere or literary tour of Tartu.
